titleInfo.title: Coll 20/26 'Muscat: Coinage of Muscat and Oman'

physicalDescription.extent: The file is arranged in chronological order from the back to the front.

Foliation: the main foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 17; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio. An additional foliation sequence is present in parallel between ff 2-16; these numbers are also written in pencil, but are not circled.A previous foliation sequence, which is also circled, has been superseded and therefore crossed out.

mods.abstract: The file contains letters from a M Comencini, author of Coins of the Modern World 1870-1936, to the Department of Overseas Trade and the India Office requesting information on the currency and coinage in use in Muscat and Oman and the Indian States. Replies from the two departments are included, giving what information they have and referring Comencini to more appropriate offices.At the back of the file (folio 16) is a map of Kalat and the Gwadur [Gwadar] region, showing the contested boundaries between the two territories. This has been misfiled and forms an enclosure to Memorandum No. F. 57-BPG/46 from the Government of India, External Affairs Department, dated 12 November 1946.
